ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, definitely, a heavy workload but totally worth it if you enjoy the material.

Interesting class, good discussions. Professor can be a bit intense leading discussion but he never put anyone on the spot. LOTS of reading--don't expect to be able to do it all. Short paper and long paper that requires a foreign-language source, so get started well before reading period

Its a spectacular class but is a massive amount of work. Take it if you're willing to work and think the material is interesting. Also, don't be afraid of the professor - he's brilliant and is really cool after the first couple of classes.
This was a great class. Definitely take it.
Yes, great history seminar. You learn a lot about areas of the world you probably haven't studied. Will help you understand current events better knowing this history.
Overall it was a good course and an interesting perspective on the Cold War.

Absolutely fantastic. I wouldn't change anything about this course, which I don't say about most courses. Well designed, and Friedman is a great leader in seminar discussion. Good balance with the workload, and I enjoyed coming to this course every week. I learned an incredible amount about the Cold War in the Third World, which is under-studied, and I left inspired to further study this topic.
